result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tommy Lee Love Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Oliver C Smith appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Russell J. A. Jones appeared by video for Oliver C Smith.  Attorney Matthew Torbenson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant has three cases before the court.
Court notes that defendant has filed a number of pro se bail motions.
Court holds colloquy with defendant as to pro se filings; defendant has counsel and Court does not typically review pro se filings when represented by counsel.
Court reviews history of case and charges with the parties.
For reasons stated on the record, Court denies any modification to bail at this time.

Case remains scheduled for final pre-trial, jury status hearing and jury trial in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms

Defendant Tommy Lee Love Jr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court for Tommy Lee Love Jr.  Defendant's appearance waived.  Attorney Patricia Irene Daugherty in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference. Case scheduled for status conference to follow case 22CF2084; defense filed notice of motion and motion to suppress custodial statements for defendant's other case 22CF2084. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in room 310 of the Safety Building with Judge Franke. Defendant to be produced. Status conference scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Tommy Lee Love Jr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland appeared by video for Tommy Lee Love Jr.  Attorney Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Status Conference. Defendant not produced. Discussion with parties put forth on the record. Court orders case adjourned for a status conference date to Br 16.
Status conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Tommy Lee Love Jr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland appeared by video for Tommy Lee Love Jr.  Attorney Amy Spanczak appeared on behalf of Patricia Irene Daugherty in court for State of Wisconsin. Case in court for Status Conference. Defendant not produced. Defense counsel informs court that they are in receipt of a global offer, but needs additional time to review with client. No objections from the State. Court grants request and adjourns matter for a Status Conference date to Br 16.
Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Tommy Lee Love in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Amy E Spanczak appeared on behalf of Patricia Daugherty for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. Defendant not produced. Defense counsel requests an additional Status Conference date, due to reasons put forth on the record. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

OFF THE RECORD- Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court, defendant Tommy Lee Love not in court, in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared on behalf of Patricia Daugherty for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. All parties appeared via zoom. Defendant not produced. Defense counsel advises that they have received discovery materials with the exception of body camera footage, but are still awaiting an offer from the state. Court schedules next court date for a Status Conference, and sets 07/26/2022 deadline for the state to turn over any outstanding discovery and an offer to defense. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tommy Lee Love in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Defendant Tommy Lee Love in custody. Thomas Hassle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective J. Lanza. Court took Judical Notice of case 17CF3171.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel

Court ordered no contact with co-defs:  Desmond Love and Oliver Smith
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Tommy Lee Love in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Tommy Lee Love in custody.  Kenneth Olstinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tommy Lee Love appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
